rlang.grounding.utils.primitives module¶

class rlang.grounding.utils.primitives.Action(input_array: Any)¶

Bases: rlang.grounding.utils.primitives.Primitive

class rlang.grounding.utils.primitives.Primitive(input_array: Any)¶

Bases: numpy.ndarray

Represents a batched real-valued object.

States and Actions should be easily batchable. This takes care of that.

as_tuple()¶
unbatched_eq(other)¶
unwrap()¶
class rlang.grounding.utils.primitives.State(input_array: Any)¶

Bases: rlang.grounding.utils.primitives.Primitive

Represents a State object.

Parameters

input_array – a numpy array or list representing a state or set of states.

Examples

s1 = State(3)
>> State([3])
s2 = State([3, 4])
>> State([3, 4])

rlang.grounding.utils.utils module¶

class rlang.grounding.utils.utils.Domain(value)¶

Bases: enum.Enum

Enum representing the domain or codomain of a OldGroundingFunction

Domain enums can be automatically combined using an addition operation:

Domain.STATE + Domain.ACTION == Domain.STATE_ACTION
ACTION = 2¶
ANY = 1¶
BOOLEAN = 7¶
FACTOR_STATE = 17¶
NEXT_STATE = 5¶
REAL_VALUE = 11¶
REWARD = 19¶
STATE = 3¶
STATE_ACTION = 6¶
STATE_ACTION_NEXT_STATE = 30¶
STATE_NEXT_STATE = 15¶
STATE_VALUE = 13¶
